ninja.ugly.prevail.datamodel
Class DataModel

java.lang.Object
  ninja.ugly.prevail.datamodel.DataModel

public class DataModel
extends java.lang.Object

An event driven data model giving access to registered 'chunks' of data.

A DataModel is a container of Chunks, optionally registered to different 'segments' of the DataModel. Each Chunk defines its own CRUD operations on its own classes. Some Chunks might merely hold objects in memory, whilst others might persist objects via a network API or local database. In all cases, the Chunks present a consistent interface. Chunks themselves are accessed synchronously, however when registered on a DataModel they can be accessed asynchronously. Chunks are registered on the DataModel with an optional 'segment', that is a key that addresses possibly many Chunks.

addChunk

public void addChunk(Chunk chunk,
                     java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)
Add a Chunk to the default segment of this DataModel. Run its operations on the given ExecutorService.

Parameters:
chunk - The Chunk to add
executor - The ExecutorService on which to run the Chunk operations. If null, a default single-threaded ExecutorService will be used.

addChunk

public void addChunk(java.lang.String segment,
                     Chunk chunk,
                     java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)
Add a Chunk to the given segment of this DataModel. Run its operations on the given ExecutorService.

Parameters:
segment - A String naming the segment
chunk - The Chunk to add
executor - The ExecutorService on which to run the Chunk operations. If null, a default single-threaded ExecutorService will be used.

delete

public <K> java.util.concurrent.Future<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> delete(K key,
                                                                                 DeleteEventFactory... deleteEventFactories)
Delete the given key from all Chunks registered at the default segment of the DataModel.

Optional event factories may be given, which are forwarded to the Chunk's delete method. These events will be dispatched, in addition to events from any DeleteEventFactory already added to the respective Chunk.

This method returns a Future containing a List of results from each registered Chunks' delete operation. Rather than wait on the result of this future, client code should usually await a event from an EventFactory.

Type Parameters:
K - The type of the key on the Chunks.
Parameters:
key - The key to delete.
deleteEventFactories - An optional list of DeleteEventFactory used to generate events for this operation.
Returns:
A Future containing a list of results of each Chunk delete operation.

delete

public <K> java.util.concurrent.Future<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> delete(java.lang.String segment,
                                                                                 K key,
                                                                                 DeleteEventFactory... deleteEventFactories)
Delete the given key from all Chunks registered at the default segment of the DataModel.

Optional event factories may be given, which are forwarded to the Chunk's delete method. These events will be dispatched, in addition to events from any DeleteEventFactory already added to the respective Chunk.

This method returns a Future containing a List of results from each registered Chunks' delete operation. Rather than wait on the result of this future, client code should usually await a event from an EventFactory.

Type Parameters:
K - The type of the key on the Chunks.
Parameters:
segment - A String naming the segment to apply the operation. The delete operation will be propagated to all Chunks registered at the segment.
key - The key to delete.
deleteEventFactories - An optional list of DeleteEventFactory used to generate events for this operation.
Returns:
A Future containing a list of results of each Chunk delete operation.
